EmailTemplate.subject: This May in Spring
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
May 2018 Hi, Spring fans! Welcome back to another installment of This Month in Spring!
This last month has been nuts—crazier than a sac o’ cats! First of all, we IPO'd <[[https://content.pivotal.io/announcements/pivotal-software-lists-on-nyse-as-pvtl?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]>. That's kind of awesome. Shortly after that, we at Pivotal celebrated our fifth birthday <[[https://content.pivotal.io/blog/5-lessons-on-pivotal-s-fifth-birthday?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]> as a startup—happy birthday to us!
Your humble correspondent has hit the road! I started in Paris, France, and then hit New York City for the big NYSE bell ringing ceremony! Then it was on to Mainz, Germany; Linz and Vienna, Austria; Melbourne, Australia (where I am now, but only after a 12-hour layover in Bangkok, Thailand); Manchester and London, UK; Denver, CO; Kyiv, Ukraine; Dublin and Belfast, Ireland; Barcelona, Spain; and then finally Singapore. That's it, for now, before I fly back home to San Francisco early in June, 2018. For the details on where and what, check out this blog post <[[http://joshlong.com/jl/blogPost/april-and-may-2018.html]]>. In all of that, I'll have presented with the first two founders of Spring—Rod Johnson and Juergen Hoeller—albeit in different places.
During this time I also put out the first four installments of the first season of Spring Tips videos in 2018, starting with videos on the new Kafka Streams binder <[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/04/04/spring-tips-spring-cloud-stream-kafka-streams?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]> for Spring Cloud Stream, Redis <[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/04/18/spring-tips-redis?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]>, the reactive Cloud Foundry Java client <[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/04/11/spring-tips-the-cloud-foundry-java-client?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]>, and Spring Statemachine <[[https://spring.io/blog/2018/04/25/spring-tips-spring-statemachine?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]>.
And, of course, the Pivotal and Spring ecosystems have been moving a mile a minute so without further ado, read on to see what you missed in the last month if you blinked.
The Long and short of it <[[https://content.pivotal.io/blog/this-month-in-spring-may-2-2018?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]>
SpringOne Tour Keeps on Trucking
The metaphorical bus stops in Denver <[[https://springonetour.io/2018/denver?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]> May 14–15, before heading on to St. Louis <[[https://springonetour.io/2018/st-louis?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]> May 30–31. If you can’t make these dates but still want a taste of what to expect at the main event <[[https://springoneplatform.io/?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]> this September in D.C., check out our tour page <[[https://springonetour.io/?utm_source=spring-newsletter&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-newsletter-may-2018]]> to find out when we’ll be rolling into your city or town.
